content:
• Thursday, February 2, 2012
  • SNE

    Sony (NYSE:SNE) bounces +5.6% on short covering in local Japanese markets this evening after...

    Sony (NYSE:SNE) bounces +5.6% on short covering in local Japanese markets this evening after reporting a staggering $2.1B loss for the last quarter yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATML

    Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML) resumes trading down 5.9%, following its Q4 warning. Cypress Semiconductor...

    Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML) resumes trading down 5.9%, following its Q4 warning. Cypress Semiconductor (NASDAQ:CY), another major player in the touchscreen controller market, could join Atmel in seeing selling pressure tomorrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM
  • SIMG

    Silicon Image (NASDAQ:SIMG): Q4 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $58.7M (+12.9% Y/Y)...

    Silicon Image (NASDAQ:SIMG): Q4 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $58.7M (+12.9% Y/Y) beats by $3.3M. Shares +3.9% AH.(PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 PM
  • N

    More on NetSuite's Q4: In addition to beating Q4 estimates, NetSuite's billings rose 36% Y/Y to...

    More on NetSuite's Q4: In addition to beating Q4 estimates, NetSuite's billings rose 36% Y/Y to $78.8M, easily outpacing revenue growth of 23%. The company is guiding for Q1 revenue $67.5M-$68M ($67M consensus) and EPS of $0.02-$0.03 ($0.04 consensus). It's also forecasting 2012 revenue of $295M-$300M ($294.3M consensus) and EPS of $0.19-$0.21 ($0.21 consensus) N +4.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:54 PM
  • SSD

    Simpson Manufacturing (NYSE:SSD): Q4 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $130.7M (+9.3%...

    Simpson Manufacturing (NYSE:SSD): Q4 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $130.7M (+9.3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • TSYS

    TeleCommunication Systems (NASDAQ:TSYS): Q4 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $121.8M...

    TeleCommunication Systems (NASDAQ:TSYS): Q4 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $121.8M (+19% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM
  • DRIV-OLD

    More on Digital River's Q4: In spite of the strong Q4 beat, the company expects Q1 revenue of...

    More on Digital River's Q4: In spite of the strong Q4 beat, the company expects Q1 revenue of $99M-$101M and EPS of $0.27-$0.30, below a consensus of $104.4M and $0.33. It's also guiding for 2012 revenue of $402M-$409M and EPS of $1.20-$1.28; the former is below a $420.1M consensus, but the latter is mostly above a Street forecast of $1.21. $29.7M in shares were repurchased in Q4. DRIV-OLD +7.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • OPLK

    Oplink Communications (NASDAQ:OPLK): FQ2 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $43.3M (-16.7%...

    Oplink Communications (NASDAQ:OPLK): FQ2 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $43.3M (-16.7% Y/Y) beats by $1.3M. Shares -1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM
  • ATML

    Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML), whose exposure to the high-end Android tablet market has been seen as a...

    Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML), whose exposure to the high-end Android tablet market has been seen as a liability, warns it expects Q4 revenue of $384M, down 20% Q/Q and well below a $412.1M consensus. Atmel says Q4 sales were hurt by the pushout of an $11M payment from an Asian distributor, though that can't fully account for revenue falling $28M below Street forecasts. Shares are halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM
  • ARR

    Armour Residential REIT (NYSE:ARR) falls 2.1% AH after filing to sell 22M shares, good for...

    Armour Residential REIT (NYSE:ARR) falls 2.1% AH after filing to sell 22M shares, good for proceeds of $158.4M based on today's close. Armour, which filed for an 8M share offering in December, plans to use the proceeds from its latest offering to purchase mortgage-backed securities (i.e. agency securities).

     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM
  • NOA

    North American Energy Partners (NYSE:NOA): FQ3 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.22. Revenue of $284.6M...

    North American Energy Partners (NYSE:NOA): FQ3 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.22. Revenue of $284.6M (+7.2% Y/Y) beats by $35M. Shares -8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • INFN

    More on Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN): Q4 beats across the board despite a slip in revenue Y/Y, as...

    More on Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN): Q4 beats across the board despite a slip in revenue Y/Y, as bottom-line margins benefitted from unanticipated year-end budget spending by a number of customers and a successful execution of its disaster recovery process following the floods in Thailand. Shares +9.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • N

    NetSuite (NYSE:N): Q4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $64.1M (+23.1% Y/Y) in-line....

    NetSuite (NYSE:N): Q4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $64.1M (+23.1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +3.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • CRM

    More on Constant Contact's Q4: The company expects Q1 revenue of $59.1M-$59.4M and EPS of...

    More on Constant Contact's Q4: The company expects Q1 revenue of $59.1M-$59.4M and EPS of $0.09-$0.10; the former is in-line, but the latter is below a $0.12 consensus. In addition, deferred revenue only rose by $600K in Q4, to $29M, and new customer adds were flat Y/Y at 45K. The results might lead to concerns that new competition from Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM) is having an effect. CTCT -7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI) drops 22.4% AH after reporting FQ3 revenue of $404.4M (+25% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.35,...

    THQ (THQI) drops 22.4% AH after reporting FQ3 revenue of $404.4M (+25% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.35, badly missing a consensus of $417.6M and $0.65 in spite of a major warning in December. THQ, whose survival is increasingly being questioned, also says it's halting development of kids' console games, and plans to stop making its poor-selling uDraw tablet. THQ claims these actions will cut annual expenses by $160M.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • INFN

    Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN): Q4 EPS of -$0.06 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $112M (-4.4% Y/Y) beats by...

    Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN): Q4 EPS of -$0.06 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $112M (-4.4% Y/Y) beats by $15M. Shares +9.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • CTCT

    Constant Contact (NASDAQ:CTCT): Q4 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $57.5M (+21.2% Y/Y)...

    Constant Contact (NASDAQ:CTCT): Q4 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $57.5M (+21.2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • CDNS

    Cadence Design (CDNS +7.8%) finishes the day solidly in the green after beating Q4 estimates...

    Cadence Design (CDNS +7.8%) finishes the day solidly in the green after beating Q4 estimates yesterday. DA Davidson added to the updraft by upping the shares to Buy on the stronger than expected results and raised 2012 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • CATM

    Cardtronics (NASDAQ:CATM): Q4 EPS of $0.36 in-line. Revenue of $174.2M (+29.3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Cardtronics (NASDAQ:CATM): Q4 EPS of $0.36 in-line. Revenue of $174.2M (+29.3% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares -5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • CYMI

    More on Cymer (NASDAQ:CYMI): Q4 beats on all counts, but the stock is trading lower in the...

    More on Cymer (NASDAQ:CYMI): Q4 beats on all counts, but the stock is trading lower in the post-session after the company forecast FQ1 revenue below Street consensus. It now expects to earn about $138M, below the Street view of $148M. Shares -1.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • HAYN

    Haynes International (NASDAQ:HAYN): FQ1 EPS of $0.68 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $128.9M (+21.1%...

    Haynes International (NASDAQ:HAYN): FQ1 EPS of $0.68 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $128.9M (+21.1% Y/Y) misses by $9M. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • DRIV-OLD

    Digital River (NASDAQ:DRIV-OLD): Q4 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $112M (+14.7% Y/Y)...

    Digital River (NASDAQ:DRIV-OLD): Q4 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $112M (+14.7% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Shares +7.5% AH.(PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • TRMB

    Trimble Navigation (NASDAQ:TRMB): Q4 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $435.2M (+35% Y/Y)...

    Trimble Navigation (NASDAQ:TRMB): Q4 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $435.2M (+35% Y/Y) beats by $16.1M. Company expects Q1 revenue of $477M-$482M and EPS of $0.61-$0.63, above a conesnsus of $453.1M and $0.58. TRMB +13.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • BEBE

    bebe stores (OTC:BEBE): FQ2 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $152M (+11.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    bebe stores (OTC:BEBE): FQ2 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $152M (+11.6% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) guides on its Q4 earnings call (webcast) for 2012 revenue growth of...

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) guides on its Q4 earnings call (webcast) for 2012 revenue growth of just 10%, below a 19.6% consensus. The company expects 2012 EPS of $0.96-$1, below a $1.24 consensus. In addition, 58% of 2012 sales are expected to come in the second half. Like others, Acme primarily blames weak capex among North American service providers for its woes. APKT -11.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • NVLS-OLD

    Novellus Systems (NASDAQ:NVLS-OLD): Q4 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $282.7M (-26.5%...

    Novellus Systems (NASDAQ:NVLS-OLD): Q4 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $282.7M (-26.5% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • EW

    More on Edwards Life Sciences (NYSE:EW): Q4 beats on EPS but misses on revenue, due in large...

    More on Edwards Life Sciences (NYSE:EW): Q4 beats on EPS but misses on revenue, due in large part to the late approval of Sapien, its catheter-delivered heart valve. The device gained FDA approval in late November and saw only marginal sales impact during the quarter. Shares -4.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • WYNN

    More on Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN): Q4 beats on a per share basis but comes up just shy on...

    More on Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN): Q4 beats on a per share basis but comes up just shy on revenue. Profit increased 8.6% Y/Y driven by a 9.1% increase in revenues from its Macau Operations and a 7.2% increase from Las Vegas. The company also declared a $0.50 dividend payable on March 1. Shares -2.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • SUN

    Sunoco (NYSE:SUN) announces several big moves to go with its Q4 report. Chairman and CEO Lynn...

    Sunoco (NYSE:SUN) announces several big moves to go with its Q4 report. Chairman and CEO Lynn Elsenhans is stepping down, and will be replaced by CFO Brian McDonald. The company plans to repurchase 19.9% of outstanding shares over the next 12-18 months, and is increasing its quarterly dividend to $0.20/share from $0.15/share. Also, $400M worth of debt will be retired. SUN +2% Y/Y
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN): Q4 EPS of $1.55 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $1.34B (+9% Y/Y) misses...

    Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN): Q4 EPS of $1.55 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $1.34B (+9% Y/Y) misses by $19M. Shares -3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT): Q4 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $83M (+18% Y/Y) misses by...

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT): Q4 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $83M (+18% Y/Y) misses by $2.2M. Will provide outlook during earnings call, which starts at 4:30 PM ET (webcast). Shares halted. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX): Q4 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $563.3M beats...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX): Q4 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $563.3M beats by $45M. Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • PXD

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +3.8%) added proved reserves totaling 148M barrels of oil...

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +3.8%) added proved reserves totaling 148M barrels of oil equivalent during 2011 from discoveries, extensions, improved recovery and technical revisions of previous estimates. The total equates to replacing over three times its 2011 full-year production of 49M barrels.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • CME

    CME Group's (CME +6.8%) Q4 results show worries about MF Global customer losses cost it...

    CME Group's (CME +6.8%) Q4 results show worries about MFGlobal customer losses cost it revenue, profit and trading volume, but plans to launch a $100M guarantee fund for farmers and ranchers, and provide up to $25,000 per account if customers suffer losses from the insolvency of a CME clearinghouse member or other market participant.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • EDMC

    After the U.S. government weighed in on unethical practices and low graduation rates, for-profit...

    After the U.S. government weighed in on unethical practices and low graduation rates, for-profit educators began making changes. But Education Management (EDMC -16%) reacted later than others, and now it's paying the price in enrollment declines - a 5% drop in its latest quarter, 9% so far in this one - and analysts say further cost cuts to help the bottom line will be difficult.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • MTSN

    Mattson Technology (MTSN +19.2%) continues to power higher, with its solid Q4 report given a...

    Mattson Technology (MTSN +19.2%) continues to power higher, with its solid Q4 report given a boost by an upgrade to Buy at Craig-Hallum and positive comments out of Needham. Craig-Hallum cites the company's positive earnings momentum, while Needham says the stock still looks undervalued despite the stock's 120% rally since early January.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • OTEX

    Shares of Open Text (OTEX +16%) soar after blowing away FQ2 earnings yesterday. Total revenue...

    Shares of Open Text (OTEX +16%) soar after blowing away FQ2 earnings yesterday. Total revenue jumped 20% Y/Y on strength in its services, technology and financial services verticals. Separately, Stifel Nicolaus ups the stock to Buy on the solid report.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • RDWR

    Radware (RDWR +3.1%) moves up after RBC upped the shares to to Sector Perform earlier today,...

    Radware (RDWR +3.1%) moves up after RBC upped the shares to to Sector Perform earlier today, based on re-accelerating growth, a revamping of its product line and improved earnings visibility.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • CI

    Cigna's (CI -3.9%) earnings fell 37% in Q4 amid acquisition-related charges and accounting...

    Cigna's (CI -3.9%) earnings fell 37% in Q4 amid acquisition-related charges and accounting changes, but the bigger weight on shares is the insurer's downward earnings guidance and rising use of medical services in the new year. Cigna expects 2012 EPS of $5-$5.40 vs. $5.68 consensus. Peers also are lower: AET -0.3%, CVH -1.2%, HUM -1.4%, UNH -1.4%, WLP -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • CELL

    Mobile phone logistics firm Brightpoint (CELL -16.1%) tumbles after delivering in-line Q4 EPS in...

    Mobile phone logistics firm Brightpoint (CELL -16.1%) tumbles after delivering in-line Q4 EPS in spite of a healthy revenue beat (the result of competition, and a mix shift towards low-margin services), and lowering its 2012 EPS guidance to a range of $1.07-$1.17 ($1.16 consensus). Brightpoint also says it expects the number of devices it handles to fall 15%-20% Q/Q in Q1, worse than normal seasonality. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • TDW

    Tidewater (TDW +4.7%) jumps after its FQ3 easily beats estimates, as better margins and fleet...

    Tidewater (TDW +4.7%) jumps after its FQ3 easily beats estimates, as better margins and fleet utilization rates easily offset higher fuel costs. Additionally, Pritchard ups the shares to Buy, saying the resolution of its Saudi Aramco contract removes uncertainty, and industry fundamentals continue to improve.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • AMP

    After Ameriprise (AMP -6.4%) reported a 22% drop in Q4 earnings on lower revenue,...

    After Ameriprise (AMP -6.4%) reported a 22% drop in Q4 earnings on lower revenue, RBCCapital says it continues to believe that improving funds flows at AMP's Columbia money management subsidiary will lead to an increase in the company's ROE. The firm maintains a Top Pick rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +4.1%) pops after Collins Stewart (Buy) writes the Japanese Ministry of...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +4.1%) pops after Collins Stewart (Buy) writes the Japanese Ministry of Health has indicated it will support the reimbursement of prostatectomies performed using Intuitive's da Vinci surgical robots, beginning in April. The firm also expects Intuitive and Japanese partner Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) to pursue reimbursement for other da Vinci procedures. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • BMY

    Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +10.8%) continues to soar (previously) following the FDA's approval...

    Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +10.8%) continues to soar (previously) following the FDA's approval of its Bydureon diabetes drug, developed in partnership with Alkermes (ALKS +1.3%). Piper (Overweight) thinks Bydureon's dosing flexibility gives it an edge over Novo Nordisk's (NYSE:NVO) Victoza drug, and that FDA approval paves the way for an international licensing deal or acquisition.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMPUY

    Impala Platinum (OTCQX:IMPUY -2.6%) fires 17,200 workers, including 13,000 who participated in a...

    Impala Platinum (OTCQX:IMPUY -2.6%) fires 17,200 workers, including 13,000 who participated in a work stoppage, after a court order declared the pay strike at its Rustenburg platinum mine - the world’s biggest - was illegal.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • BIG

    Big Lots (BIG +6.1%) posts a solid gain after earlier reporting Q4 retail sales of $1.6B, an...

    Big Lots (BIG +6.1%) posts a solid gain after earlier reporting Q4 retail sales of $1.6B, an increase of 7.7% Y/Y. Same store sales comps were also up 3.4%. The company raises Q4 earnings guidance on the strong result, now expecting to earn $1.71 - $1.74 per share, up from previous estimates of $1.59 - $1.66.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -3.6%) says an FDA advisory committee will meet in the second...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -3.6%) says an FDA advisory committee will meet in the second quarter to discuss the company's resubmitted application for its weight-loss drug lorcaserin. There are concerns by many analysts that lorcaserin may not be as effective as other drugs being developed.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • OA

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK -3.2%) is lower today after missing the mark on its FQ3 EPS. Profit...

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK -3.2%) is lower today after missing the mark on its FQ3 EPS. Profit fell 29% Y/Y as the defense contractor posted weak sales in its aerospace and armament systems segments. Security and sporting sales rose, but not enough to mitigate the shortfall. The company also lowers its FY12 guidance and announces a restructuring.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • BCO

    The folks in the business of guarding money - Brink's (BCO -17.6%) - had a harder-than-expected...

    The folks in the business of guarding money - Brink's (BCO -17.6%) - had a harder-than-expected time making money in Q4. The firm cites higher security costs and the continuation of price and volume pressure as factors that drove down its profit in the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +2.7%) says it's been selected by America Movil (AMOV +0.51%) - the leading...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +2.7%) says it's been selected by America Movil (AMOV +0.51%) - the leading wireless services provider in Latin America - to provide infrastructure for its LTE/4G mobile network rollout in the region.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • PTNR

    Israeli mobile carrier Partner Communications (PTNR +4.7%) rises after Scailex, which owns a...

    Israeli mobile carrier Partner Communications (PTNR +4.7%) rises after Scailex, which owns a 44.5% stake in Partner, announces it has hired Deutsche and Lazard to assist in finding a buyer for at least part, and perhaps all, of its stake. It's added Deutsche is willing to provide potential buyers with a credit line of $1B, if necessary. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • ALV

    Autoliv (ALV -2%) trades down after Citigroup cut the shares to Sell, citing rising pricing...

    Autoliv (ALV -2%) trades down after Citigroup cut the shares to Sell, citing rising pricing pressures and margin concerns. Separately, Societe Generale also lowered its rating to Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • NOC

    Northrop Grumman (NOC -0.8%) trades lower after BofA Merrill Lynch cut the shares to...

    Northrop Grumman (NOC -0.8%) trades lower after BofA Merrill Lynch cut the shares to Underperform, citing the defense contractor's disappointing FY12 guidance yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +1.9%) spikes following a rumor that Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) is...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +1.9%) spikes following a rumor that Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) is interested in buying the company. However, Vodafone says there's no truth to it.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • VHS

    Vanguard Health (VHS -1.8%) trails the market after being cut to Market Perform at Wells Fargo,...

    Vanguard Health (VHS -1.8%) trails the market after being cut to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, citing concerns over a reduction in capital expenditures and the impact it will have on operational improvements.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • SYKE

    Sykes Enterprises (SYKE -3.9%) is reduced to Neutral from Outperform at Robert W. Baird, which...

    Sykes Enterprises (SYKE -3.9%) is reduced to Neutral from Outperform at Robert W. Baird, which sees "limited near-term upside" as the stock now trades near its four-year average NTM P/E multiple. The firm believes management could be conservative with initial 2012 guidance, particularly given recently announced restructuring efforts.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • SD

    Sandridge Energy (SD -9.2%) is lowered to Market Perform at Howard Weil, which notes "several...

    Sandridge Energy (SD -9.2%) is lowered to Market Perform at Howard Weil, which notes "several curiosities" behind its acquisition of Dynamic Offshore: "The most prevalent head-scratcher is SD's willingness to pay $1.3B for Dynamic after investors showed little interest in a similar pricing range," during an aborted IPO. Shares also are cut at Tudor Pickering.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • GMCR

    Bulls are gloating following Green Mountain Coffee's (GMCR +20.6%) strong FQ1 (I, II) and...

    Bulls are gloating following Green Mountain Coffee's (GMCR +20.6%) strong FQ1 (I, II) and soothing FY12 guidance. KeyBanc, a stalwart defender, notes Green Mountain's 4.2M Keurig shipments blew past its 3M forecast, and that free cash flow was positive in spite of rising spending. During its earnings call, Green Mountain mentioned Keurig-based brewers accounted for 37.5% of all U.S. coffeemaker sales in FQ1 (per NPD).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics (STLD -1.9%) gets hit by a Bank of America downgrade to Neutral on valuation this...

    Steel Dynamics (STLD -1.9%) gets hit by a Bank of America downgrade to Neutral on valuation this morning. BofA says the stock has outperformed the market and its peers since early January, and it prefers Allegheny Technologies (ATI +1.6%) for growth and the valuation and defensiveness of Reliance Steel (RS +0.7%) and Nucor (NUE -0.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • ISIL

    Needham cuts Intersil (ISIL -5.4%) to Hold from Buy after the semiconductor company's Q1...

    Needham cuts Intersil (ISIL -5.4%) to Hold from Buy after the semiconductor company's Q1 guidance was materially below consensus. Given that revenue is forecast 22% lower Y/Y at the midpoint of the guidance range, "it will be hard to contemplate a flat 2012, let alone a year of growth," the firm says, forecasting a 9% revenue decline.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
